Question: As of 2024, how many ships are currently in the Disney Cruise Line fleet?
AnswerBonus: There are five ships: the Disney Magic, Wonder, Dream, Fantasy, and Wish. (The sixth ship, Disney Treasure, is set to join in late 2024.)

Question: In what year did Disney Cruise Line launch its first ship, the Disney Magic?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Magic’s maiden voyage was in July 1998, marking the beginning of Disney Cruise Line operations:contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}.

Question: Which two Disney Cruise Line ships are known as the “Magic class” sister ships?
AnswerBonus: The Magic (1998) and Wonder (1999) were the first two ships and share a similar design.

Question: Which two Disney Cruise Line ships are sister ships in the "Dream class"?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Dream (2011) and Disney Fantasy (2012) are sister ships, both larger vessels with similar layouts.

Question: Which Disney Cruise Line ship made its debut in 2022 as the first of a new class of ships?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Wish set sail in July 2022 as the first of Disney’s new Triton-class (or Wish-class) ships.

Question: Which upcoming Disney Cruise Line ship will feature the new "Plaza de Coco" restaurant (as of 2025)?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Treasure (launching in 2024) is home to Plaza de Coco, a Coco-themed family dining experience:contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}.

Question: Which Disney Cruise Line ships feature the AquaDuck water coaster?

Choices.D: All Disney ships have the AquaDuck

AnswerBonus: The AquaDuck debuted on the Disney Dream and is also on the Disney Fantasy. (It’s a tandem water coaster that winds around the ship’s decks.)

Question: What is the name of the first-ever Disney attraction at sea, a water ride that debuted on the Disney Wish?
AnswerBonus: The AquaMouse is a two-seater water coaster on the Disney Wish, complete with show scenes and Mickey & Minnie cartoon segments:contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}:contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}.

Question: On which Disney cruise ship can guests visit the Star Wars: Hyperspace Lounge, a Star Wars-themed bar experience?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Wish features the Hyperspace Lounge, an immersive bar that transports guests to various Star Wars planets via panoramic “windows.”

Question: What adult-exclusive Italian restaurant can be found on every Disney Cruise Line ship?
AnswerBonus: Palo, an adults-only restaurant serving Northern Italian cuisine, is a staple on all Disney ships. ("Palo" means "pole" in Italian, referencing the gondola poles of Venice:contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}.)

Question: What is the first Castaway Club membership tier to earn a complimentary Palo dinner on each sailing?
AnswerBonus: Platinum- and Pearl-level Castaway Club members (10+ cruises for Platinum, 25+ for Pearl) receive one free Palo dinner each cruise:contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}.

Question: True or False: Disney Cruise Line ships are permitted to have yellow lifeboats instead of the regulation orange.
AnswerBonus: True. Disney obtained special permission for its lifeboats to be Mickey Mouse yellow (RAL 1004) instead of standard orange, to match the ships’ color scheme.

Question: The horns on Disney Cruise Line ships play the first seven notes of what famous Disney song?
AnswerBonus: All Disney ships’ horns can sound out the iconic opening line of “When You Wish Upon a Star.” The Disney Dream and Fantasy horns even include extra tunes like “Yo Ho (A Pirate’s Life for Me)” and “A Dream is a Wish Your Heart Makes”:contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}.

Question: How many “captains” can be found on each Disney cruise ship (including both real and character captains)?
AnswerBonus: There are four: the ship’s actual Captain, Captain Mickey Mouse, Captain Minnie Mouse, and Captain Jack Sparrow. (Captain Hook often appears too, but the classic trivia answer is four.)

Question: What is the name of Disney Cruise Line’s private island in the Bahamas, visited on most Caribbean itineraries?
AnswerBonus: Castaway Cay is Disney’s 1,000-acre private island in the Bahamas, featuring beaches, snorkeling lagoons, and even an onboard post office.

Question: True or False: Guests can send mail from Disney’s Castaway Cay that gets a special Castaway Cay postmark.
AnswerBonus: True. Castaway Cay has a functioning Bahamian post office. Postcards sent from there receive a unique Castaway Cay postmark (just remember to bring Bahamian postage stamps).

Question: What was the name of Castaway Cay before Disney purchased and developed it?
AnswerBonus: Disney’s Castaway Cay was formerly known as Gorda Cay. Disney developed the once-sparsely used island into a private cruise destination in the late 1990s.

Question: What is the name of the adults-only beach on Castaway Cay?
AnswerBonus: Serenity Bay is a tranquil, adults-only beach on Castaway Cay, located farther down the island and accessible by tram.

Question: Which Disney Cruise Line ship was the first to offer “Frozen” dining entertainment with the restaurant Arendelle: A Frozen Dining Adventure?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Wish debuted Arendelle: A Frozen Dining Adventure, a dinner show where Anna, Elsa, and friends entertain guests in a Frozen-themed banquet.

Question: Which Disney cruise ship features the Marvel cinematic dining experience "Worlds of Marvel"?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Wish introduced Worlds of Marvel, an interactive dining experience with Avengers-themed shows (and the Disney Treasure will have a similar Marvel dining venue as well).

Question: On which Disney ship can you dine at Tiana’s Place, the Princess and the Frog-themed restaurant with live jazz music?
AnswerBonus: Tiana’s Place is exclusive to the Disney Wonder. It was added in a 2016 refurb, replacing a former Caribbean-themed restaurant:contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}.

Question: Rapunzel’s Royal Table, a Tangled-themed dining experience, is found on which Disney cruise ship?
AnswerBonus: Rapunzel’s Royal Table is on the Disney Magic, featuring characters from Tangled during dinner. (The Magic received this restaurant in 2018, replacing Carioca’s.)

Question: In 2016, the Disney Wonder was refurbished and a restaurant was removed to make way for Tiana's Place. What was the name of the original restaurant that it replaced?
AnswerBonus: Tiana’s Place on the Disney Wonder replaced Parrot Cay, a Caribbean-themed restaurant. (They also added the French Quarter Lounge during the 2019 updates:contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}.)

Question: All Disney cruise ships have a buffet restaurant, but the name of the buffet differs by ship. What are the two buffet restaurant names used across the fleet?
AnswerBonus: The classic ships and Dream-class have “Cabanas” as the buffet, while the newer Disney Wish (and Disney Treasure) feature “Marceline Market”:contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}.

Question: “Preludes” is the snack bar outside the Walt Disney Theatre on most Disney ships. Which ship does NOT have a Preludes concession stand?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Wish is the only ship without a Preludes snack bar in front of its main theater:contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10} (the Wish has alternate ways to get theater snacks, including roaming wait staff).

Question: In Animator’s Palate, what unique design feature do the butter knives have, and what does it represent?
AnswerBonus: At Animator’s Palate restaurant, the butter knives are designed as paintbrushes, reflecting the theme of art and animation. (You can even buy souvenir paintbrush butter knives in the gift shop:contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}!)

Question: How many Italian mosaic tiles are used in the mural of King Triton and Ariel inside Triton’s Restaurant on the Disney Wonder?
AnswerBonus: Approximately 200,000 hand-crafted Italian tiles make up Triton’s beautiful undersea mural:contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12} – and it only took about 5 days to install the entire mosaic!

Question: On the Disney Dream, there’s a sweets shop themed after a character from Wreck-It Ralph. What is the name of this candy-loving character?
AnswerBonus: Vanellope’s Sweets & Treats on the Disney Dream is named after Vanellope von Schweetz from _Wreck-It Ralph_. **Fun Fact**: Vanellope is voiced by Sarah Silverman:contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}.

Question: On the Disney Wish, Disney Treasure, and upcoming Disney Adventure, there’s a frozen treat stand named after a Toy Story 2 character. What is the name of this character?
AnswerBonus: The ice cream spot called Wheezy’s Freezies (named after Wheezy the penguin from _Toy Story 2_) appears on the Disney Wish, Treasure, and the future Disney Adventure.

Question: Mickey waffles are a popular breakfast treat on Disney cruises. They actually come in two different flavors. What are the two Mickey waffle flavors available?
AnswerBonus: Disney Cruise Line serves classic vanilla Mickey waffles and a cinnamon-sugar **churro** flavored Mickey waffle. (The churro flavor became a hit after guests raved about it:contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}!)

Question: Which Disney Cruise Line ship features a bronze atrium statue of Princess Ariel from The Little Mermaid?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Wonder’s grand lobby showcases a bronze statue of Ariel on a seashell base. (Each ship’s atrium has a unique character statue – the Wonder’s is Ariel.)

Question: Which Disney Cruise Line ship’s stern features Rapunzel (with Pascal) decorating it?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Wish has Rapunzel (from _Tangled_) painting the ship’s name on its stern, with Pascal holding her hair. (Each ship has a different character tableau on the aft stern.)

Question: Which Disney Cruise Line ship has Dumbo the Flying Elephant and Timothy Q. Mouse on its stern (back of the ship)?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Fantasy’s stern features Dumbo flying with Timothy Mouse. (In contrast, the Disney Dream has Sorcerer Mickey with the magic brooms on its stern.)

Question: The sports pub on the Disney Dream is named “687.” What does this number represent?
Answer: The Disney Dream’s shipyard hull number
AnswerBonus: Pub 687 on the Disney Dream is named after the ship’s hull number (project #687) at the Meyer Werft shipyard:contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}. It’s a tribute to the Dream’s building history.

Question: The pub "O’Gills" found on some Disney ships is named as a reference to which classic Disney live-action film?
AnswerBonus: The name “O’Gills” is a nod to the 1959 Disney film _Darby O’Gill and the Little People_, which makes it a fitting name for an Irish pub-themed lounge:contentReference[oaicite:16]{index=16}.

Question: What lounge on the Disney Wish is themed after "The Princess and the Frog", complete with live music and beignets?
AnswerBonus: The Bayou is an informal lounge on the Disney Wish inspired by _The Princess and the Frog_. It features a New Orleans vibe with wrought-iron decor, jazz music, and even beignets on the menu.

Question: On which ship can thrill-seekers try the AquaDunk, a high-speed drop-out waterslide?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Magic sports the AquaDunk, a near-vertical drop waterslide added in its 2013 renovation. A trapdoor releases riders to slide through a clear tube over the side of the ship!

Question: Which Disney ships feature the Midship Detective Agency, an interactive mystery game played via enchanted art around the ship?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Dream and Fantasy have the Midship Detective Agency game, where guests use clue cards to interact with animated artwork and solve mysteries (like locating stolen dalmatians or missing art).

Question: True or False: Disney Cruise Line was the first cruise line to include a fireworks show at sea as part of its entertainment.
AnswerBonus: True. Disney Cruise Line pioneered regularly scheduled fireworks at sea with its "Pirates IN the Caribbean" deck party. Disney had to develop special low-ash fireworks for use over water.

Question: In 2019, Disney Cruise Line introduced a new character appearance to inspire young women in maritime careers. Who made her debut as a Disney Cruise Line Captain in 2019?
AnswerBonus: Captain Minnie Mouse was introduced in 2019:contentReference[oaicite:17]{index=17}. Minnie, donning a Captain’s uniform (with pants), now appears onboard to encourage girls to consider careers at sea.

Question: Who served as the godmother of the Disney Dream cruise ship, having been chosen for her connection to Disney and her award-winning singing career?
AnswerBonus: Jennifer Hudson christened the Disney Dream as its godmother in 2011:contentReference[oaicite:18]{index=18}. Fittingly, before her fame and Oscar-winning career, she was a performer aboard the Disney Wonder.

Question: Which famous singer was named the godmother of the Disney Fantasy when the ship launched in 2012?
AnswerBonus: Mariah Carey served as the Disney Fantasy’s godmother, presiding over its christening ceremony in 2012. (Each Disney ship has a notable godmother to bless the vessel at launch.)

Question: Where were the Disney Cruise Line’s first two ships (Magic and Wonder) built?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Magic and Wonder were constructed at Fincantieri shipyards in Italy. In contrast, Disney’s later ships (Dream, Fantasy, Wish, Treasure) were built by Meyer Werft in Germany.

Question: What is the name of Disney Cruise Line’s second private destination island in The Bahamas, scheduled to open for cruises in 2024?
AnswerBonus: Lighthouse Point, located on Eleuthera island, is Disney’s new tropical destination (opening 2024). It’s being developed with an emphasis on Bahamian culture and environmental sustainability.

Question: Which Disney cruise ship is the largest in size (gross tonnage) as of 2023?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Wish (approx. 144,000 gross tons) is currently the largest Disney ship. It’s a bit bigger than the Disney Dream and Fantasy (~130,000 GT). (The Disney Treasure will be roughly the same size as the Wish.)

Question: What special feature do the inside staterooms on the Disney Dream and Disney Fantasy have that inside cabins on the older ships do not?
Answer: Virtual "Magical Porthole" screens showing real-time outside views
AnswerBonus: The Dream and Fantasy introduced “Magical Portholes” for interior cabins: a round video screen that displays a live feed of the view outside — sometimes with surprise Disney character animations floating by!

Question: Which Disney cruise ship was the first to sail cruises in Australia and New Zealand (beginning in late 2023)?
AnswerBonus: In fall 2023, the Disney Wonder re-positioned to sail out of Australia and New Zealand for the first time, offering Disney’s inaugural cruises in the South Pacific region.

Question: What is the name of the water-coaster style slide aboard Disney Treasure and Disney Destiny?
AnswerBonus: On Disney Wish, Disney Treasure and Disney Destiny, the ride is called AquaMouse. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

Question: As of late 2025, including Disney Destiny, how many ships are in the Disney Cruise Line fleet?

Question: Which of these ships has the unique water-slide called “AquaDunk” (i.e. not a raft ride)?

Question: What is the length (in feet) of the slide tubes for the AquaMouse/AquaDuck rides on the newer ships?
AnswerBonus: The AquaMouse ride on the Wish-class ships features about 760 feet of twisting tubes suspended above the decks. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}

Question: Which ship class do Disney Wish, Disney Treasure and Disney Destiny all belong to?
AnswerBonus: All three — Disney Wish, Disney Treasure, and Disney Destiny — are part of the Wish class. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}

Question: When did Disney Destiny officially begin sailing (maiden voyage)?
AnswerBonus: Disney Destiny’s maiden voyage was on November 20, 2025. :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}

Question: Which ship features a water-coaster ride that includes an animated short called “Curse of the Golden Egg”?
AnswerBonus: Disney Treasure’s AquaMouse features the movie-short “Curse of the Golden Egg.” :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}

Question: Which ship includes a bow character painted as a ‘Hero Minnie Mouse’ in superhero attire, reflecting a ‘Heroes & Villains’ theme?
AnswerBonus: Disney Destiny features a superhero-style Minnie Mouse painted on the bow. :contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}

Question: Which of these is true about the AquaMouse on Disney Destiny compared to earlier installations?

Choices.A: It uses the same animated shorts as Disney Wish
Choices.B: It adds a new villain-themed short film ‘Sing a Silly Song’
Choices.C: It is a body-slide with no raft
Choices.D: It is shorter than the AquaDuck on Dream and Fantasy

AnswerBonus: The AquaMouse on Disney Destiny includes a new short called “Sing a Silly Song,” featuring Disney villains. :contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}

Question: True or False: The slide ride on Disney Treasure and Disney Destiny is technically an AquaDuck, not AquaMouse.
AnswerBonus: Although the system is similar, on Wish-class ships (including Treasure and Destiny) the ride is branded AquaMouse rather than AquaDuck. :contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}

Question: Which ship was the first in the Wish class to debut?
AnswerBonus: Disney Wish debuted in 2022 as the first ship in the Wish class. :contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}

Question: Which coaster-style water ride extends over the side of the ship, 150 feet above the ocean, on the Dream-class ships?
AnswerBonus: On Disney Dream (and Fantasy), the AquaDuck hangs over the side and gives ocean-view thrills. :contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}

Question: How many ships were in the Disney Cruise Line fleet before the addition of Disney Treasure and Disney Destiny (i.e. prior to late 2024)?
AnswerBonus: Before Disney Treasure (2024) and Disney Destiny (2025) joined, there were 5 ships: Magic, Wonder, Dream, Fantasy, Wish. :contentReference[oaicite:16]{index=16}

Question: Which of these ships DOES NOT have the AquaDuck/AquaMouse water-coaster ride?
AnswerBonus: Disney Magic does not have AquaDuck or AquaMouse — it has a different slide called AquaDunk instead. :contentReference[oaicite:17]{index=17}

Question: What kind of itineraries did Disney Destiny sail on its inaugural season out of Fort Lauderdale?

Choices.B: 4- and 5-night cruises to the Bahamas and Western Caribbean

Question: Which statement is accurate about the ride system used by AquaDuck and AquaMouse?

Choices.A: They are standard body-slides — you go solo head-first down a flume.
Choices.B: They use two-person rafts propelled by water jets, like a roller-coaster at sea.
Choices.C: They are stationary water slides (no propulsion) and guests walk slowly through slow tubes.
Choices.D: They are dry slides — no water involved.

AnswerBonus: Both AquaDuck and AquaMouse use two-person rafts and water jets for propulsion, making them water coasters at sea. :contentReference[oaicite:19]{index=19}

Question: Which of these water rides is unique to Dream-class and not found on Wish-class ships?
AnswerBonus: AquaDuck – the high-sea water coaster – is on Dream and Fantasy, not on Wish-class ships (which have AquaMouse instead). :contentReference[oaicite:20]{index=20}

Question: True or False: On Disney Destiny, the AquaMouse ride features a villain-themed underwater movie short during the ride experience.
AnswerBonus: Yes — the AquaMouse on Disney Destiny includes a new short called “Sing a Silly Song” featuring Disney villains. :contentReference[oaicite:21]{index=21}

Question: Which of the following is a correct pair of ship and slide-ride type as of 2025?
AnswerBonus: Disney Treasure is a Wish-class ship, and it has AquaMouse. :contentReference[oaicite:22]{index=22}

Question: As of December 2025, how many ships are in the Disney Cruise Line fleet including Disney Treasure and Disney Destiny?
AnswerBonus: Disney Destiny is the 7th ship; the fleet includes classic ships plus the three Wish-class vessels: Wish, Treasure, Destiny. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

Question: What is the gross tonnage of Disney Treasure?

Question: How many staterooms does Disney Treasure have?
AnswerBonus: Disney Treasure features 1,250 staterooms according to the ship’s specs. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

Question: What unique water-ride does Disney Treasure feature, also present on other Wish-class ships?
AnswerBonus: Disney Treasure includes the AquaMouse water coaster ride, with a new short film "Curse of the Golden Egg." :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

Question: Which new short film plays on the AquaMouse ride aboard Disney Treasure?

Question: Name one of the rotational dining restaurants exclusive to Disney Treasure.
AnswerBonus: Rotational dining on Disney Treasure includes 1923, Worlds of Marvel, and Plaza de Coco. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}

Question: What is one of the specialty adults-only restaurants on Disney Treasure?
AnswerBonus: Alongside standard dining, Disney Treasure offers specialty adult-only restaurants such as Enchânté and Palo Steakhouse. :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}

Question: What classic Disney attraction inspires a bar/lounge aboard Disney Treasure?
AnswerBonus: Disney Treasure is the first in the fleet to include a Haunted Mansion–inspired bar. :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}

Question: What is the primary theme or concept of Disney Destiny’s interior and storytelling design?
AnswerBonus: The Disney Destiny is themed around the light-side / dark-side dynamic — "Heroes and Villains." :contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}

Question: When did Disney Destiny officially enter service?
AnswerBonus: Disney Destiny began service on November 20, 2025. :contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}

Question: How many passengers can Disney Destiny accommodate?
AnswerBonus: Disney Destiny is capable of carrying 4,000 passengers. :contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}

Question: Which high-end suite aboard Disney Destiny is themed after a Marvel superhero and includes four bedrooms and a spiral staircase?
AnswerBonus: The Tower Suite aboard Disney Destiny is Iron Man–themed and includes four bedrooms and a spiral staircase. :contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}

Question: On Disney Destiny, what type of themed lounge features Doctor Strange–style portals and drinks?
AnswerBonus: The Sanctum is a Doctor Strange–themed lounge on Disney Destiny. :contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}

Question: Which classic Disney film’s musical made its debut as a show aboard Disney Destiny?
AnswerBonus: Disney Destiny features a new musical show based on Disney’s Hercules. :contentReference[oaicite:16]{index=16}

Question: Which ship class do Disney Treasure and Disney Destiny belong to?
AnswerBonus: Both Disney Treasure and Disney Destiny are part of Disney Cruise Line's "Wish" class. :contentReference[oaicite:17]{index=17}

Question: What is the length of Disney Treasure in feet?

Question: What width (beam) does Disney Treasure have?

Question: What kinds of itineraries does Disney Treasure typically sail from its home port?

Answer: 4- and 5-night cruises to the Bahamas and Western Caribbean
AnswerBonus: Disney Destiny’s inaugural season consists of 4- and 5-night cruises to The Bahamas and Western Caribbean. :contentReference[oaicite:21]{index=21}

Question: Which ship was the first of the Wish-class to be launched by Disney Cruise Line?
AnswerBonus: Disney Wish was launched in 2022 as the first Wish-class ship. :contentReference[oaicite:22]{index=22}

Question: Which station aboard Disney Treasure is inspired by a classic Disney Parks attraction Jungle Cruise?

Question: On Disney Destiny, what unique feature do the dining and entertainment venues emphasize compared to previous ships?
Answer: Heroes vs Villains theme across dining, decor, and entertainment

Question: Which ride-inspired water coaster on Disney Treasure takes guests "through a mysterious ancient temple" in search of treasure?
AnswerBonus: The AquaMouse on Disney Treasure features a water-coaster journey through a temple in search of treasure in the "Curse of the Golden Egg" short. :contentReference[oaicite:25]{index=25}

Question: Which Disney Cruise Line ship followed Disney Treasure into service?
AnswerBonus: Disney Destiny entered service after Disney Treasure; Treasure began in December 2024, Destiny in November 2025. :contentReference[oaicite:26]{index=26}

Question: Which high-seas ship offers adult-only dining at Palo Steakhouse aboard Disney Treasure?
AnswerBonus: Palo Steakhouse is one of the adult-only specialty restaurants on Disney Treasure. :contentReference[oaicite:27]{index=27}

Question: Which ship is described as the third vessel in Disney’s Wish class?
AnswerBonus: Disney Destiny is the third ship in the Wish class. :contentReference[oaicite:30]{index=30}

Question: What theatrical production replaced traditional cruise shows on Disney Treasure (instead presenting a Broadway-style musical)?
